meanings.definition: A person or organization that lends money at interest.
meanings.sent1: The moneylenders in town help people who need to borrow money.
meanings.sent2: The moneylenders at the bank charge interest on the loans they give out.
meanings.sent3: The moneylenders were always ready to lend a helping hand, as long as you paid them back with a little extra.
meanings.sent4: The moneylenders' offers may seem tempting, but be cautious of the hidden fees and high interest rates.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the moneylenders who promise quick cash but trap you in a cycle of debt.

meanings.definition: Those who provide loans in exchange for interest payments.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is one of the moneylenders who helps people out during tough times.
meanings.sent2: The moneylenders in the city have strict policies when it comes to repayment.
meanings.sent3: The moneylenders joked that they were in the business of making money grow on trees, with interest of course.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, moneylenders are like gardeners, planting seeds of debt that grow into profits.
meanings.sent5: The moneylenders' office was always bustling with people seeking financial assistance.
